result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel William Tetzlaff Jr. was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 - 6 years prison / 3 years confinement and 3 years ES is imposed/Stayed not eligible for challenge or substance abuse
    Probation 3 years - $2500.00 fine/costs - 12 months county jail with good time and huber (credit for 4 days time served towards prison sentence )- bail of $1000.00 to be forwarded        to DOC to be applied towards his fines/costs - DL revoked 24 months - IID for 24 months AODA and follow thru - No bars - absolute sobriety - subject to random testing - maintain full time employment or full time education - Any conditions DOC may impose - 80 hours of community serve to be  during probation - DNA sample and surcharge

records.addlTxt: Received - FAXED LETC from DOC via Washburn co C of C
Request for revocation or suspension of huber approved revoke huber privileges
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl.  Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend counts 1 and 2 to reflect 6th offense.  Court grants motion to amend counts 1 and 2 to a 6th offense.  DE sworn by deputy clerk.  E advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. DE entered plea of NC to count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 and count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  PSI is waived by both parties.  Court finds parties have waived their right to a PSI. 

Court:  Count 1 - 6 years prison / 3 years confinement and 3 years ES is imposed/Stayed not eligible for challenge or substance abuse
    Probation 54 months - $2500.00 fine/costs - 12 months county jail with good time and huber (credit for 4 days time served towards prison sentence )- bail of $1000.00 to be forwarded        to DOC to be applied towards his fines/costs - DL revoked 24 months - IID for 24 months AODA and follow thru - No bars - absolute sobriety - subject to random testing - maintain full time employment or full time education - Any conditions DOC may impose - 80 hours of community serve to be  during probation - DNA sample and surcharge

Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl via phone.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:53 PM  Court calls case - Court makes stmt.  Atty Stangl addressed the Court DE is no longer in STOP matter is resolved - requests PLEAS be set in September.  Court makes stmt to Atty Stangl.  
COURT:  bond is revoked DE to be taken into custody until this matter is resolved (forfeiture of bail is being held open will be applied towards fine)  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
left message w/Stangl's office re motion hearing date

Non-compliance with STOP conditions of bond
Copies distributed
Copies of two separate letters from STOP Coordinator to ADA Marcoux regarding Defendant's non-compliance with bond.
to collaterally attack prior OWI convications based upon a violation of right to counsel

Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl who appears via phone.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Stangl to file motion.
Court: Motion to be filed by 4/12/16. Atty Stangl to set up motion hearing with JA Kelsey when motion is filed.  Review scheduled for May 12, 2016.
from Attorney Stangl - has received requested information from Eau Claire county - motions to be filed.

Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl by phone.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Acknowledges receipt of information.
DEF stands mute on chgs.
Court enters N/G plea on behalf of DEF.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

AMENDED
Special bond conditions
For Operating while intoxicated
1. Defendant shall not enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on the premises.
2. Defendant shall not consume/possess any intoxicating beverages.
3. Defendant shall be subject to random testing of his/her blood, breath or urine.  Shall report to Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward WI (phone 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the reandom testing.  Failure to report to the STOP Program may result in the issuance of a warrant for the defendant's arrest, modification of bail, possible bail jumping charges, and or forfeiture of bail.

Failure to report to the STOP Program may result in the issuance of a warrant for the defendant's arrest, modification of bail, possible bail jumping charges, and or forfeiture of bail.

Atty Stangl is requesting a signature bond although he has paid the cash bail.  Employment is not at LCO.  State makes stmt - not on premises of LCO and only be there for employment - STATE not employed there that can be stricken.  Cash portion be stayed.

Also has 15 TR 1087. Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:41 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Defendant's Atty wishes to waive the prelim.  Court addressed the defendant as to his rights to have a prelim.  Defendant does not wish to have a prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam - finds probable cause and binds the defendant for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Ordered that the suspension of Daniel Tetzlaff's driving privileges are stayed pending judicial determination of administrative decision.
Judicial Review Request
to amend cash bail to signature bond

Defendant Daniel William Tetzlaff in court with attorney Patrick Joseph Stangl appears by phone.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.    Bond Continues.   DEF waives time limits for the Preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.

1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of:   LCO CASINO
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3.
